question: A 60-year-old male presents with end-stage renal disease, hyperkalemia, and metabolic acidosis. He also has hyperparathyroidism as a physiological response to hypocalcemia. What is the patient suffering from?

A male was caught red-handed while robbing a chemical store at Jodia bazaar. A mob was gathered and started brutal violence against the robber. One of the men bought a chemical from the nearby store and forced the robber to drink it. The helpless person did as directed, and after a few minutes developed severe convulsions, cyanosis, and dyspnea. Blood-stained froth could be seen in his mouth. What is the most likely cause of poisoning?
Osteoporosis is a major adverse effect caused by glucocorticoids. Which of the following correctly explains this?
Which of the following insulin analogs is a long-acting preparation?
Thyroid hormone preparations like levothyroxine act on which of the following receptors?

A farmer’s wife while picking cotton from cotton pods develops nausea and dyspnea. When taken to hospital she was diagnosed with organophosphorus poisoning. What is the most likely route of entry of poison in this patient?
The anti-inflammatory effects of glucocorticoids are due to which fundamental mechanism?

answers.option: Simulate histamine release from mast cells
Inhibit leukotriene and prostaglandin synthesis via inhibition of phospholipase A2

question: A drug addict keeps scratching his body and complains that he feels insects creeping on his body. What is he suffering from?

A man, charged with murder, pleaded insanity in a court of law. He was brought before the medical officer for examination. How will the medical officer differentiate between true and feigned insanity?

answers.option: In feigned insanity the onset is gradual
In feigned insanity peculiar facial expressions are absent
In feigned insanity the person appreciates repeated examination
In feigned insanity fatigue does not set in
In feigned insanity behavioral disturbances are uniform

question: An asthmatic individual who is on regular therapy for the past year develops symptoms of Cushing's syndrome. What is the most likely etiology?
A 6-year-old child presents with signs and symptoms of adrenal insufficiency. He also has a long history of mucocutaneous candidiasis. What is the most likely diagnosis?
The poisoning caused by which of the following substances presents with gastrointestinal irritation, black-colored urine, and loin pain?
Excessive growth hormone release in adults leads to which condition?
Hürthle cell variant is seen in which of the following?
What is the most common source of ectopic adrenocorticotropic hormone (ACTH) production?
Which of the following statements is incorrect for the pancreas?

answers.option: Head lies in the concavity of duodenum
Uncinate is present behind the superior mesenteric vessel
Islets are mostly present in its head region
Tail is related to the hilum of spleen

question: Which of the following statements is incorrect about the pituitary gland?

answers.option: Pars nervosa consists of unmyelinated axons
Blood supply by the branches of internal carotid artery

question: A 30-year-old woman complains of increased weight gain, fatiguability, depression, and poor memory for the past 3 months. She has pale dry skin and raised blood pressure. What is the most common investigation that will be advised?
In untreated primary hypothyroidism which of the following thyroid function test results are most likely to be seen?

answers.option: Decreased free T4, decreased or normal TSH, decreased T3
Increased free T4, increased TSH, increased T3
Decreased free T4, increased TSH, decreased T3
Increased free T4, decreased TSH, decreased T3
Increased free T4, decreased TSH, increased T3

question: When considering thyroid hormone replacement therapy in case of primary hypothyroidism which of the following precautions must be taken?

answers.option: Thyroxine should be stopped as soon as the patient becomes euthyroid
Thyroid hormone pill should be taken with breakfast
Elderly people should be started at higher doses of thyroxine
Thyroxine should be taken on an empty stomach in the morning
Thyroid hormone needs to be replaced for three months

question: A patient has thyroid and liver disease with altered thyroid-binding globulin (TBG) levels. Which of the following has the highest affinity for TBG?
Which of the following is an incorrect statement about the thyroid gland?

answers.option: Calcitonin is formed by follicular cells
Superior thyroid artery is a branch of external carotid artery
Inferior thyroid vein drains into left brachiocephalic vein
Its capsule is formed by pretracheal fascia
It lies in front of 2nd and 3rd tracheal rings

question: 24-year-old primigravida presents to the clinic with anemia and lethargy. Her mother had a thyroid disorder. She is advised thyroid profile. Which of the following levels will be checked?

answers.option: Serum TSH, free T3, free T4

question: A 54-year-old female presents to the outpatient clinic with a complaint of attacks of numbness on and off in her lower limbs. Her bone profile shows serum calcium 1.93 mmo/L (2.10-2.65 mmol/L), serum urea 4.2 mmol/L (3.6-6.6 mmol/L), serum phosphorus 2.56 mmol/L (1.75-1.9 mmol/L) and blood parathyroid hormone 12 pmol/L (15-62 pmol/L). What is she suffering from?

A 54-year-old, married woman para-2 comes to the clinic with the complaint of weight gain and lethargy for the past 3 months. She had her last menstrual period 6 years back. Her blood pressure is 150/90 mmHg, her pulse is 65/min, and is regular bilaterally. Her body mass index (BMI) falls in the obese range. Her eyes are puffy, she complains of breathlessness, and cold intolerance, her skin is coarse and her abdomen has white striations present. What is the best diagnostic test for this woman?

answers.option: Oral glucose tolerance test and TSH

question: A 46-year-old male presents to the outpatient department with complaints of increased appetite, nausea, headache, fatigue muscle weakness, and pain in the limbs. His laboratory results show serum calcium 2.92 mmol/L (2.10-2.65 mmmol/L), serum urea 5.9 mmol/L (3.6-6.6 mmol/L), and blood parathyroid hormone 97 pmol/L (15-62 pmol/L). What is the most probable diagnosis?

A 54-year-old female visits an endocrinologist with the complaint of not being able to notice the slipped-off slipper from the foot during walking until she looks at her feet. History suggests that she is a known case of diabetes for the past 10 years. What is the most likely diagnosis?

40-year-old presents to the outpatient department with a complaint of neck swelling for the past month. Her biopsy results show rapidly dividing follicular cells with optically clear nuclei, intracellular inclusions, and concentric calcifications. The patient is suffering from which of the following?
Which of the following is incorrectly matched with their classification?
Which of the following is incorrectly matched?

answers.option: Hydrocortisone: short to medium acting glucocorticoid

question: Which of the following is used for the screening of congenital hypothyroidism?

A 5-year-old girl presents to a rural dispensary and her height and weight are <2nd percentile and 3rd percentile respectively. There is no significant family history. Clinical examination is otherwise unremarkable. Which of the following conditions is most likely the cause of short stature in this girl?

A 39-year-old female visits the endocrinologist with her routine lipid profile result. The doctor suspects the metabolic syndrome in the patient. Which of the following lipid profile results meets the criteria for this syndrome?
Which of the following catalyzes the conversion of glucose into sorbitol?
Which of the following is characteristic of Hashimoto thyroiditis?

answers.option: Multiple hyperplastic nodules and compressed thyroid at periphery
Lymphoid follicles with germinal centers and Hurtlhe cells
Follicular cell hyperplasia and scalloping of colloid
Diffuse fibrous deposition between atrophic follicles

question: A 30-year-old male presents to the clinic with neck swelling and a history of weight loss of 5 kg over a month. On examination, exophthalmos, diffuse thyroid swelling, and non-pitting edema over the legs. His laboratory results show elevated T4 and decreased TSH. What will be seen in his thyroid biopsy?

answers.option: Lymphoid follicles with germinal centers and Hurtle cells
Follicular cell hyperplasia and scalloping of colloid
Diffuse fibrous deposition between atrophic follicles
Multiple hyperplastic nodules and compressed thyroid at periphery

question: Which of the following drugs regulates the transcription of insulin-responsive genes including the genes responsible for lipid and glucose metabolism and insulin signal transduction?
Which of the following drugs is incorrectly matched with its adverse effects?

A man is brought to the district hospital after being bitten by a snake on foot. He complained of localized pain and swelling of the foot. He then started bleeding through his mouth and nose. On examination, petechial hemorrhage could be seen under his skin. He got bitten by which type of snake?
A young boy is brought to the hospital in a state of shock and fright after being bitten by a cobra on hand. What is the next step of management after reassuring the patient?

answers.option: Wash the wound with soap and water

question: What is an interpretation of external stimuli or objects known as?

A patient is suspected to have Addison's disease due to the impairment of the hypothalamic-pituitary-adrenal axis (HPA) axis. Which of the following drugs can be given to the patient to confirm this diagnosis?

A 25-year-old lactating female comes to the office with a painful swelling on her left breast for the last 5 days and fever for the last 2 days. The swelling has enlarged progressively with increasing pain. On examination, the swelling is located in the left upper quadrant, is erythematous, soft, and tender. What is the most likely diagnosis?

A 34-year-old woman presents with a painless swelling on the left side of her neck for the past 3 months. According to her, it has increased only slightly in size. Her pulse is 90 beats/min, BP is 110/70 mmHg, the temperature is 99 degrees Fahrenheit. On examination, the swelling moves on deglutition. What is the most appropriate initial investigation in this patient?

An infant presents to the outpatient department with complaints of lethargy, difficulty in feeding, and constipation for the past 1 month. On examination, the baby has a protruded tongue, husky cry, and an umbilical hernia. Laboratory results show an increased level of TSH and reduced levels of free T4. What is the most likely diagnosis?

An 11-year-old girl has a short stature and increased weight. She also complains of cold intolerance and increased sleep. Her bone age is delayed. Lab results show an increased level of TSH and a reduced free T4. What is the most likely diagnosis?
What percentage of patients with Addison's disease have vitiligo?
Which part of the anterior pituitary secretes most of the hormones?
Which of the following is a life-threatening complication that may occur with improper management of diabetic ketoacidosis?

A 28-year-old woman presents to the endocrine clinic with secondary amenorrhea and galactorrhoea for the last 6 months. Her general physical and systemic examination is normal. Lab investigations reveal, prolactin = 3250 mU/L (60–620), free T4 = 15.5 pmol/L (11.5–22.7), thyroid-stimulating hormone (TSH) = 2.5 mU/L (0.35–5.5), and urine pregnancy test is negative. What is the most likely diagnosis?
Which of the following increases the hypoglycemic effects of sulfonylurea?
Which of the following attenuates the hypoglycemic effects of sulfonylurea?
How do 2nd generation sulfonylureas differ from the 1st generation ones?

answers.option: They are less prone to cause hypoglycemia
They do not lower blood sugar in nondiabetic subjects
They are effective in emergency situations

question: Sulfonylureas are a drug of choice for which of the following?
Which of these drugs inhibits the synthesis of thyroid hormone and inhibits the peripheral conversion of T4 to T3 hormone?

A 35-year-old, mother of two children, comes to the clinic with a history of amenorrhea for 6 months and headaches for 3 months, For some days she is also experiencing increased milk production from her breasts. She has concerns about her vision as she recently escaped an accident while overtaking a school bus while changing lanes. On examination she is not pregnant, her blood pressure is normal and she is afebrile. On optometric examination her lateral vision was found to be reduced. Which of the following lab test findings is most likely to be present in this woman?
Anaplastic tumors of the thyroid gland have which of the following characteristic?
A patient diagnosed with Graves disease is taking propylthiouracil and propranolol. What is the adverse effect of the anti-thyroid medication?
Which drug increases insulin sensitivity by increasing peripheral receptors for insulin?
In an elderly man with hypothyroidism, rapid administration of levothyroxine can cause which of the following?
Which of the following features is unique to Grave disease?

A 29-year-old patient comes with complaints of fever and sore throat. On examination, her throat is congested and her thyroid is palpable. Labs reveal that TSH is 6.8 mmol/dL and T4 and T3 are normal but at the lower end of the reference range. What is the possible diagnosis?
What is the most common side effect of insulin?
Which of the following is a consequence of long-term glucocorticoid therapy?
Pituitary tumors are a feature of which of the following?

A 19-year-old girl is brought to the emergency room by her family who reports that she swallowed a liquid poison in a suicide attempt. On examination, she is bradycardic, hypotensive, flaccid, has excessive salivation, and has convulsions and fasciculations. What is the likely cause of poisoning?
A woman taking corticosteroids for chronic interstitial lung disease (ILD) develops moon facies and weakness. Her lung functions have improved over time. What is the most appropriate management?
Which of the following is a feature of papillary carcinoma?

A young female presents to the clinic with tremors, excessive sweating, and tachycardia. On examination, a solitary thyroid nodule with irregular margins is observed. What would be the next appropriate investigation?

A young male patient is suffering from a delusional belief where he imagines that he is going to be poisoned by his relatives, wife, and son and they will rob his property. What is this type of delusion called?
Which of the following has an autoimmune etiology?
A 20-year-old male presents with fever, fatigue, and an enlarged thyroid gland that is tender to palpation. He recovers completely in about a week. What is the most likely diagnosis?
An 8-year-old child presents to the clinic with short stature. A growth hormone deficiency is suspected. Which of the following lab values is the most appropriate test to perform in this child?
Which of the following is an effect of regular insulin?

A 31-year-old female develops shortness of breath. On examination, she is observed to have a raised jugular venous pulse (JVP) and muffled heart sounds. She has a history of hypothyroidism. Which of the following is the likely reason for the new findings?
Which of the following is characteristic of papillary thyroid carcinoma?
A patient reports to the psychiatry ward with a firm belief that somebody wants to kill him. What is this type of delusion called?
High calcitonin levels with a nest of polygonal cells and amyloid deposits on cytology is seen in which of the following?
Which of the following changes is made to the dosage of levothyroxine for a pregnant woman in her 2nd trimester?
Which virus can cause diabetes mellitus?

A 7-year-old boy, who is healthy and school-going, comes to the outpatient department accompanied by his parents, for the evaluation of short stature. He is usually lethargic and is not performing well in school. What is the most likely diagnosis?
Which drug causes a decrease in insulin resistance by upregulating peroxisome proliferator-activated receptor gamma (PPAR-γ)?
Which of the following hormones does not use cyclic adenosine monophosphate (cAMP) as a second messenger?
